name: General Mix #1 Multiple Choice Quiz | Mixed 10 Questions | 10 Questions

questions.text: In the mountains of Oiartzun, the mysterious cromlechs were made by which group of people?
questions.explanation:
Basque.

	Cromlechs are neolithic standing stones, much like those found at Stonehenge.  The Basque people reside in northern Spain and southwestern France.

questions.text: What type of painting is a Camaieu?
questions.explanation:
monochrome.

	Similar to the word 'cameo', a camaieu is a painting on a marble or other non-paper medium that has the appear of relief.

questions.text: Sabah is an area of which of the following countries?
questions.explanation:
Malaysia.

	Sabah is a portion of Malaysia that can be found on the island of Borneo.  Borneo is also occupited by Brunei and Indonesia.

questions.text: What is the homophone for cousin?
questions.explanation:
cozen.

	To 'cozen' someone is to cheat them.  So please, don't cozen your cousin!

questions.text: What is a person missing if he is suffering from aphakia?
questions.explanation:
A lens in the eye.

	A person who does not have a lens would suffer from extreme myopia.  A lens may be removed during cataract surgery...and in some rare cases people may be born without their lens.

questions.text: What word describes a person who misses the ball completely in a golf swing?
questions.explanation:
whiff.

	The term 'whiff' may also be applied to baseball, where the sound of a quickly swung bat might resemble a 'whiff'.

questions.text: Who was the legendary founder of the Korean kingdom ca. 2333 BCE?
questions.explanation:
Tangun.

	There is no evidence of the genuine existence of Tangun, he is merely a figure of legend, much like the Yellow Emperor of China.

questions.text: The 'Green Baize' was laid out in what type of plays?
questions.explanation:
tragedy.

	The Green Baize was a cloth which was placed on the stage during the performance of tragedies in which several characters were to die, to avoid getting their costumes soiled.  This practice gave rise to the term 'Tragic Carpet'.

questions.text: Who created the first Kinetic Sculpture?
questions.explanation:
Duchamp.

	Duchamp's 1913 work called 'The Bicycle Wheel' is considered to be the first kinetic (meaning 'moving') sculpture, as the wheel could be interactively turned.  All of the other artists included here are well-known for their work in kinetic sculpture as well.

questions.text: What type of people were in the Q Guilds?
questions.explanation:
butchers.

	Also called the 'Guild of Q', it is still in existence to this very day!  Thank you for playing this quiz...please try some of my other challenging stuff if this was to your liking.
